column1: Helluin was the name in Middle-earth for the star known today as http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sirius Sirius
column2: the "Dog Star". It was part of Telumehtar
column3: the name the Elves gave to the constellation http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orion_%28constellation%29 Orion.;

column1: The second element in Helluin is said to be the Elvish luin ("blue").
Its possible that the first element refers to Elvish for "ice" (see: Helcar) in which case the name means "ice-blue".
